abstract: An economist argues that the financial regulation bills don’t do enough to force Wall Street firms to have a stake in the securities they put together.
snippet: An economist argues that the financial regulation bills don’t do enough to force Wall Street firms to have a stake in the securities they put together.
lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, I mentioned four big issues to watch as the House and Senate try to put together a final financial regulation bill. But, obviously, there are more than four issues that matter. David A. Levine — an investor and economist in New York, formerly with Sanford C. Bernstein — offers this additional idea in an e-mail message:

headline.main: Not Enough Skin in the Game
